rComments: Very good professor, the textbook he provides is very helpful for the research essay, the lecture content is a bit boring, but very basic. The writing requirements are very high, with a total of 4 assignments (including midterm and Final exam) of about 8,000 words. Get ready to write, and good luck!
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', 'Get ready to read', 'So many papers']

rComments: if your views don't align with his don't even bother taking his course. very unprofessional and biased prof, stated ridiculous opinions since the first day, do yourself a favour and never take a class with him.
He really taught this course too difficult. The midterm, final exam, outline and essay add up to nearly 8,000 words, the requirement is too high for a freshman.

The class itself was organized. You only had to do an outline, essay, midterm and final. Instructions were clear and grading was quite fair (I was consistently under the word count and did fine, but I think it really depended on your TA). Lectures tended to be a little dry and tough to get through.

DPA's always respectful + prepared for class. Graded on 4 things, which is good w/ recorded lectures. Grading depends on TA; some are hard, and some are easy; his lectures are kinda slow. Had 2 textbooks (1 is impossible to find cheap). He's clear w/ his criteria and gives time to work on things; not hard to get an A if you understand the subject.
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Get ready to read', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: Professor Pierre-Antoine has been one of my favourite political science professors so far because he always comes to class prepared, is highly knowledgeable, and gives challenging content with an excellent use of examples and evidence. He is also very kind and respectful!
I don't really get his low rating. Yeah the lectures were dry, but I still learned. Nice guy and pretty easy marker.

I've had this prof twice and I loved both classes. It's a lot of work, but it pays off and it's always enjoyable. He's understanding and cares about his students. The lectures are interesting with the occasional funny anecdote. I've only gotten grades above B with him and my best grade was an A-. Overall satisfied, but the textbooks are expensive.

Honestly, he is a great prof. His lectures content is very organized so no need to search thru zoom dates. The assignments can be a lot to write but it is not very hard. He is very caring and understanding too. However, the course depends on how lucky you get with a TA, as same essay format between students could get a diff grade because of the TA.

I'm a first year and I found DPA to be a pretty good prof. The assignements weren't t0o crazy, the only thing that was a bit tough was reaching the word count for the midterms. Some of the midterm question weren't too difficult for the word count but some of them make you stretch for info.
Nice man. will give generous extensions. on the conservative side but overall non-bais and a kind.

I read through the other reviews, but in the end DPA was a very good prof to me and even though I procrastinated horribly and waited to write my essay outline and research essay with about 1 day left, I still succeeded in the class. Graded pretty fairly and I received good feedback on my grades. If you like poli sci and want a challenge, take him.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: Prof is available and helpful in office hours and emails, but you gotta work for the credit. You need to get lucky w the TA's cause some of them are Tough graders and picky. The word-count is tough especially for first-year but you can def do it. Prompts are not hard but they're painful, you can use an external source and WATCH THE LEC RECORDINGS!
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: The prof was v respectful and knowledgeable. He tries to give unbiased political information and he explains v well. Only graded on midterm, exam, essay outline, and essay so everything Matters, but it's stress-free till you have to submit those. Get the textbook online cause you can word search and provide quotes for exams! Coursepack was a waste.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: He isokay, the usual professor who gives decently engaging lectures and expects a lot in return. He is not super available but somewhat clear in explaining things. The course structure is organized which helps when his exams are worth a lot. Take him if you actually need to and expect to write lengthy papers on simple concepts.

Loved the guy. You can tell he's very knowledgeable in his field. Take-home exams provided us with 4 prompts and we had to pick two to answer. Definitely need the textbook, he covers most of the material in class but the textbook goes into further detail and for the midterm and final you needed it. Super funny and nice, I recommend

Will not take this prof again. Tries to say he can't share his opinion when asked yet does through his delivery of the course material. Skip his gender lecture if you don't want to listen to transphobic rhetoric. TA's take ages to grade things (like truly ages). Midterms are not always clear and many students had to stretch to make the word count

He's okay. Grades on assignments were released late (didn't receive our first mark until after midterm) and it's hard to get feedback on exams and essays. You have to be lucky with your TA as some are more communicative than others. I skimmed through lecture slides and the textbook for exams, it was simple enough. Good luck if you have him.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: This prof almost made me switch out of my major. Many of the things he said were objectively incorrect, and his reception to feedback was 0. His was one of my only in person classes that semester and I couldn't even bring myself to go because I would have to listen to him there.

DPA does't communicate assignment expectations clearly and writes lazy midterms/exams. i considered dropping poli sci altogether - his lectures were boring and never touched on actual political events that were happening in the world.

DPA is a good prof. Dull lectures, but assignments are pretty straightforward (and also common sense). A good class to work on your writing, since you end up writing nearly 8000 words. You can tell he is slightly apathetic about teaching but he is accessible and pretty fair. His rating is deserved but you don't need to avoid this prof's class.

I really liked the prof. Lectures were interesting (for the most part), very well spoken and organized. Class was made up of 4 written assignments, together totaling to around 7700 words. I can agree that the midterms are hard to stretch to the word count he wants, but definitely not a bad class, and definitely doesn't deserve this low rating

Really good prof, was surprised to see his grading so low. He gives clear instructions on what he wants to be done in your work. Lectures are just a bit boring, I could never get myself to listen but as long as you're reading the textbook or have an understanding of politics you will ace this class.
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Get ready to read', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: honestly an amazing prof, surprised to see his reviews this low. his class had 4 assignments, including the midterm and exam. the first assignment is literally your outline for the final one so if you feel that his class load i to heavy you just have poor time management skills. He always has office hours where he can answer your questions.
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures ', 'Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Great prof! I don't know why anyone would say otherwise. One of the best profs I had in my 2021 fall semester!
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: This is the second time I've had Prof Pierre-Antoine and I have enjoyed both classes I have had with him. The content is easy to understand and the assignments are straight forward. In both classes I have finished at or above a 90 and have not found him to make his content extremely difficult. Would take again

I took him in the fall semester of 2020. It was hard to watch the lectures because they were regularly over 90min and because it was recorded it was impossible to get in contact with other students. The projects are complicated but there were only 4. I managed to pass without watching lectures or doing readings but it wasnt easy, avoid if possible
teacherRatingTags: ['So many papers', 'Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: He thinks 2500 words are short and it doesn't matter to answer each question with 1000 words. you are not allowed to use any external source but just several chapters of the textbook, anyway, everybody knows that textbook usually illustrates some concept and brief reason, how that support 1000 words essay? The knowledge is not hard, he does.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'So many papers', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: nothing that he assigned was very clear, but he would get frustrated whenever students would ask questions to clarify about his very unclear assignments. we literally only had 4 things that we were graded on, a paper outline, a midterm, a final paper, and our final exam (all papers btw) so LOTS of writing and no room for mistakes.
His lectures are useless because he puts all of the important material in the textbook that is needed to read. Stuck reading and his lectures are just him reading off of slides.
teacherRatingTags: ['So many papers', 'Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: There is a lot of reading to do. The exams are take home exams and he gives you many days to complete them. The classes are interesting. I watched them on 1.5 speed.
The exams were all take home exams. You had multiple days to write the exams. The readings were not too long and the textbook was straightforward. His classes were very interesting.

DPA is hands down the best prof I've had since coming to uni. He uses slide shows, is personable, makes sense, his examples and exams match his materials and he's all around just a great prof. If I could take him every year if I could because his approach towards the students actually makes you enjoy learning his content. Overall just a solid prof!

The class content is very clear and simple. He organizes well his lectures, midterms and readings. We used a textbook that mainly helped for midterms. His midterms and final exam were papers, not tests with MCQ or short answers. He gave us 2-3 days to write it, and we had to answer 2 questions among 4-5 questions. His lectures can be monotone tho.
A really good prof!! the tests are a little difficult but just study hard. Super understanding and supportive.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Accessible outside class', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Not my favourite prof... Seems to have a lot going on in their life

this course was mandatory for me but it was honestly quite interesting and the professor was clear with what his expectations were. there was a midterm and a final, as well as two assignments/papers. none of the exams are multiple-choice questions.

hes honestly the most boring prof ive ever had. he assigns like 600 pages of reading aside from the textbook, but i never really read them and would just skim through to find info if i needed it for an exam. His exams are pretty easy, but hes so boring and monotone that his lectures are just painful. I almost switched major. Avoid him if you can.
Lectures were really boring and unnecessarily long, readings were super long. If you have strong self discipline you'll be fine or else don't take it
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: He's a very good prof. Knowledgeable and always makes sure we understand the content. Exams are take-home, around 1200 words per essay which is fine. There's 2 per exam. You have a choice of topics and its fairly easy. Lectures are posted as videos. Only thing is he complains abt too many emails and would rather students join his office hours.

Mr. Pierre-Antoine is an extremely basic Prof. His Mid-term and final exam are both take-home which makes it easier due to Covid but they are very very very LONG. Get ready to write ALOT. The material is interesting but gets boring after a while.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: He was respectful, knowledgeable and although always complained about receiving too many emails, he was available for questions and clarification outside class. I liked his exams and assignments essay format but they were a bit tough

His videos are really good. Because of corona, I haven't spoken to him much but he has great TAs who are willing to video call if you have questions. You do read a lot though, but if you're interested by the subject you'll love his classes.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Amazing lectures ', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Don't listen to anyone in this comment section. Prof Pierre-Antoine was a very good prof. He was organized, understanding, and very clear in his lectures. He was always there to help (he set up office hours every week) and he makes a lot of "dad" jokes which were very funny to watch online. Highly recommend. Put in the effort in this class tho!

Lots of readings. Only grades on midterm, essay (split into two assignments worth 15% and 35%), and take-home exam. All essays. The course itself isnt difficult, honestly. Disorganized, posts late, lectures seem useless. Just read the powerpoints.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'So many papers', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Lectures are very long and very boring. Really makes you hate the idea of politics and is the epitome of boring politics profs. Only midterm, research essay and a final to get marked on - NO grading criteria, all essay questions, dk your first mark until after the drop deadline, no live lectures to get a feel for his expectations Just don't bother
always posted lectures late, never had any clear instructions for ANY assignments, midterms or exam. sent an email with details that needed to be included for our midterm 6 HOURS BEFORE IT WAS DUE!!
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'So many papers', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Les lectures sont immenses et le contenu est très difficile a suivre. Je regrette d'avoir pris ce cours.

Professor Pierre-Antoine is a fantastic example of someone who knows how to approach students with different learning styles. He tailors his lectures according to the subject matter and is always encouraging us to participate and discuss different ideas in a constructive way. He does not ask us to regurgitate material but instead asks us to THINK.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: I thought this class was great. It could have been because I was really interested in the topic but I found the lectures engaging and the assignments very easy. Like others have said, we didn't received our marks really late but it was also a summer class so this might be different if you take it during the fall/winter. Overall, would recommend.
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Get ready to read', 'Amazing lectures ']

rComments: midterm is alright you have lots of options of questions to answer. research paper and take home exam is essays like 10 pages each, so lots of research and writing. the prof is just ok really. its such an average class. wouldnt avoid at all costs, but definitely rather take a different class.

He didn't give back any marks until the second last lecture. He forgot to register exams for access students so we all had to write our midterm a week late. He kept delaying giving back grades and then kept giving extensions on assignments. I ended up doing every assignment/exam within the final 2 weeks of the course. Id mention more if I had space
cours interessant mais le prof n'est pas assez clair pour ses travaux
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Get ready to read', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Monsieur Pierre-Antoine est bien. Mais il semble avoir quelques difficultés à sexprimer quand il explique la matière et peu faire des commentaires disciplinaires. Vous devez faire votre part et faire les lectures

It's a boring class, you do not need to attend. He had to cancel a number of classes and we understood why. You'd think he'd be a bit more sensible for the final exam but he was not. He gave us an 8-page take-home exam a week after the 15-page paper was due and the questions are really ambiguous. Do not ever take a class with him. I regret it.
teacherRatingTags: ['So many papers', 'Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: Boring class, the prof has potential but cannot express it with this class. You do not need to attend...
Good guy, cares about student success. Not his fault the class is boring.

Very boring lectures. I'm not a polisci student so maybe that's why they're so boring but don't need to show up and you will do just fine. Feel like he has potential but this class doesn't do him justice.

Was honestly a good class overall, I enjoyed the class material and I found he covered a good amount of basics for polisci students. The lectures could sometimes be a bit boring but usually, the topics he would cover were interesting enough if you enjoy politics. The final was easy and he doesn't grade a lot of things, DGD participation is a must.

Participation in the DGDs is important, they're held twice and count towards 10% of your grade. Otherwise, two 5-page essays and a final which consisted of 2 essays and 5 paragraph definitions. Prof is a nice guy and knows what he's talking about, but you can tell (and he has said directly to me) that he doesn't enjoy teaching this course.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Participation matters', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: utilise le mic svp

I really disliked having him. He isn't very approachable and doesn't give his students the information that will help them pass the exam. He creates impossible exam layouts and doesn't test you prior to them. He lets all his work be done by TA's and his lecture slides are very cluttered and unorganized. DO NOT TAKE HIM.

I took this class as an introduciton to Politcal Science and this prof read right off of the slides making attendence not mandatory. There is clear miscommunication between the TA and prof because the papers are generally marked incorrectly in comparison to the instructions. Finally, the final exam is extremly difficult. I would avoid this course.

I went to every single lecture for this class, and every time it was useless. His powerpoints have no substance, you cannot just copy down the powerpoint, you have to write what he says too. The problem is everything he says is hard to follow, and he does not talk super loud. He's a great guy, but not a great teacher. Avoid taking class with him!

The papers were easy marks in my opinion (makes up for 70% of the whole mark) and they don't need any readings done to complete them. Class attendance is NOT required, I only went to 2 classes, 2 discussion days (mandatory) and the final exam lol.

Show up to class because he adds a lot more information to his powerpoint slides (besides what is already posted on blackboard). Papers don't require attendance or reading the slides at all, but the exam you need to know the class material. Otherwise he is a typical professor who is there to teach and not to make class fun

There's a serious lack of communication between the prof and the TA, who seem to just communicate through emails... The grading criteria changes between the two so all assignments written for this course should actually be written to the TA's liking, which becomes hard because you never get an opportunity to meet them. Unclear, unprofessional.
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: I really enjoyed his lectures and would take his class again. He is encouraging and clearly cares about his students and will offer help, especially if you ask for it. He is a tough marker, but he's fair and as long as you follow the marking criteria, you will do well in his class. He's engaging and has a great sense of humour.
Excellent prof, take his class ! :D

i never took politics in high school so i wasn't sure what to expect when taking this course but honeslty this prof made things so boring i am dropping POL1102. He must tell his TAs different criteria for assignments than he tell his tudents because no one in my class did well on assignments. if you have his as a prof, switch out if you can.

Very average professor. Solid lectures and assignments, but nothing special. He barely used the textbook, but the course was pretty easy. Won't get you interested in the subject matter, but you will get a clear idea of what to expect from other poli-sci courses in the future.
He's a great prof but the exam was deadly. Not a lot of  work really.

He was a pretty good prof, but nothing special. He doesn't really answers questions very clearly, but if you talk to him outside of class you can probably get what you need. He provides really good feedback on assignments, but won't help much when you're actually writing them. His exam was the hardest I've written, with very vague questions.

Dr Pierre Antoine is a good prof to take your politics course with. He tries to be funny to get u interested and it is cute seeing him trying to be funny. He is okay, and knows how to pronounce my name well. The only sad thing is that he doesn't reply emails aspa. Well, I don't blame him, he has a life aside teaching, it is not by force to reply.

Lectures not very stimulating but must admit his pps and the course is very well-organized. Assigned two 5page position papers and gives you the sources aka. no outside research needed. As well no midterm. Mad-crazy long exam but not ridiculously hard (defs not easy tho). Always stresses how important readings are but I never did them and was okay

Unclear with grading criteria, not helpful even when you take the initiative, unrealistic expectations for a 1st year course, long and boring lectures. I had to email him THREE times to get my final assignment grade weeks after the official deadline for grade revision. Avoid if possible

The class wasn't what I expected at all, it  was very boring, and felt really long too. No tests but there was a lot of writing to do, especially during the final. Good news is, if you follow his guidelines word for word without trying to get creative you'll do well in his class. But I still recommend not taking class with him if you have a choice.

Jesus Christ...  I never thought I would dislike a Prof, but Mr. Pierre-Antoine succeeded. He made me absolutely hate politics, and his need to be constantly politically correct just hurt my head. His blatant teaching style is extremely unhelpful and boring   Here's my advice: If you have a class with him, just drop it and take another one.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Get ready to read', 'So many papers']

rComments: This guy ruined Politics and Globalization for me. He is extremely boring and bland. His teaching style just puts you to sleep, and when he answers questions, he completely misses the question and only ends up confusing you even more. I will never take a class with him again

The subject matter is very interesting, he has some very provocative discussion questions, and it's easy to contribute without having done all of (or any) of the readings. If you have a genuine interest in Gender and International Relations it will be an easy and pleasant class.

I had a large interest in political science before coming to this class, but pierre-antoine completely ruined it; he's bland, boring, and his jokes aren't funny at all. Doesn't explain what he wants on assignments, resulting in many people not getting grades they wanted.

Great prof. Very knowledgeable and you finish the course with a significantly deeper understanding of the issues addressed. His discussion questions are really interesting. He is also very understanding. I would definitely take another course with him.

He is very nice and tries to make class interesting. He is very indecisive when marking and telling you what he wants and how to do it on an assignment. He is not very helpful when you have questions.

I loved Pierre-Antoine! Such an interesting course, he used simple slides and tells you what you need to know. We didn't have a midterm, only two papers with two discussions on the topic of the papers. I bought the textbook but we didn't even open it once, just go to class and you're set. I got an A- easily. Def recommend (:

DPA is such a nice dude! Easy marker and lenient. You didn't really need to do the readings for this class seeing as there were no exams just a presentation and a final paper. However, I did not really learn anything. He's cool!

WORSE Prof. I have ever had (had him for two different courses). He reads off his slides, don't bother reading the textbook because he won't test on it, he puts everything on his slides. He is not engaging, and very boring, and has massive, very apparent biases. If you don't agree with him, then watch out if he marks your papers.
I enjoyed this class.  Interesting discussion groups.  The thing is that the TAs had to mark based on the form of the essays and if you are off by a couple of lines they take marks off.
Very clear about his expectations. Not the most interesting lecturer but the discussions groups were very good and his essay topics were really interesting.
Although his guidelines may seem strict, what he tells you for an assignment and what he tells his TA's is different. This leads to marks being deducted due to following his instructions.
Very boring prof, in no way does he give the topic life. If you can get another prof, go for it.
Very boring prof. Uninteresting and unenthusiastic. Reads off his slides which make coming to class useless.

An apt description of him is a tedious, dreary man. Though initially he may look young, his humour and his bland approach proves extremely painful after the point of 10 minutes. If you can avoid taking his class, I recommend you do it, as though other profs assign more, it's well worth having someone who will keep you awake

The prof is really boring he speaks in monotone and goes off on random tangents that are completely irrelevant. He reads off his slides and posts them on the website,so there is no reason to come to class.

This guy is really boring, tries to be funny but fails.. big time. He speaks the entire time without making the topic come to life, I have profs who are WAY better! He is not interesting, his teaching method is horrific and I'm astonished at how ridiculously redundant and stupid his essay guidelines are. Do NOT recommend!!!

The first year political science class I'm taking is just super boring, it isn't his fault! He is a pretty good prof...he's nice. That counts for something, right? Basically your classic middle of the pack professor. Nothing special.
great professor. Had him for two classes and he is really smart despite being a younger prof. Has a good sense of humour and is generally interesting to listen to. 5/5

Overall the class was pretty good. However, it is a loaded course and challenging to take during spring sem. due to time constraints. It seems the professor did not take this into account or the fact that students might have other classes and made the final cumulative with emphasis on the first half. The course is not hard just very time consuming.

His Intro to Poli-Sci course is really general. He was always very vague and made weird jokes no one ever laughed at. The two papers we had to do for his class were completely unrelated to the material covered in-class. His   exam, although easy was tremendously long and agonising

teaching assistants mark all the assignments and very poorly at that. The professor is rude (does not want students emailing him at all) Your mark rests on two pointless paper([and the ta)  and an exam. I despised this class and find that it could have been a better experience with a different professor. No point in attending his class either

Admittedly, I was wary prior to attending his class, but for a fourth year seminar, he was extremely accommodating and encouraged valuable discussion amongst my peers. The grades were posted in a document online next to the student number, and legitimately not one person in our class received below a B+. I would recommend him any day.
Would spend half the time talking about theories that has little to do with the class. confused/mixed up simple terms and was not very responsive to answering questions in class.

I really enjoyed his class and him. He clearly cares about teaching, and this is reflected in his lectures. His assginments were also super reasonable-- I would absolutely recommend taking a class with him!

I don't understand these comments either. I think he's a very good prof, who actually cares about/ puts time & effort into his lectures. His assignments are also very reasonable, and he is a generous marker. I would definitely recommend taking a class with him, especially his gender & IR course! Don't be jaded by these other comments- he's great!

Maybe he's not good at teaching first year courses or something, because I don't know what these comments are on about. I loved his class and think he is a good prof. I can see how his lectures might drag on if they were three hours but we had half lecture/half discussion and it wasn't bad at all. the readings he chose for the course were GREAT.

Overall very dissapointed with the way he teaches. Had him for 3 hours straight and it was so long because he talks about one slide for like 20 minutes and none onf that stuff was on the exam. Exam is not bad but a tough marker. He really means there is no easy marks in this class. Expect to lose your scholarship to this guy.
Generally great class.

Avoid, avoid, avoid. His lectures are three hours of dictionary definitions of various globalization topics. Makes no attempt to connect any of the concepts he "teaches". Ridiculously anal about assignments. Every section has to be an EXACT number of lines or he will deduct marks. I want my tuition back.

He seemed insecure and made lots of bad jokes but gave helpful input for the essay assignment. Assigned lots of reading that wasn't necessary. The course was almost self-explanatory. Not a bad prof, but definitely not the greatest.

WORST PROF! gave an hour lecture about how to email him! And then wasn't polite enough to answer them himself! He was so anal with Assignment format that each section had to be only a certain number of lines! not a range of lines, exactly 21 lines or you loose 2% each time! INSANE! AVOID!

Worst professor I've ever had.  He doesn't answer emails; he's rude, and it became apparent that he doesn't give a **** about teaching.If you are reading this, Mr. Antoine - just stick to research. Please!

"DPA", as he refers to himself, is an inexperienced teacher. he drags out class much too long not realizing the boredom and restlessness of the class. his awkward jokes make many uncomfortable and unwilling to learn. overall, he made the class very hard to learn from.

Daniel is the epitome of a self-righteous professor. Unfortunately for his students, he only subscribes to the status-quo of many university professors - he is obviously liberal and given to social comment upon anything that is thought to be conservative. This is not normally a problem, but with Daniel, it becomes annoying - nauseating, even.

I learned nothing in his course that I didn't already know.  He demands respect while not seeming to give it just because he's a professor which is disgusting and only accentuates the fact that he's sub-par and insecure.  Would not have him as a prof again.
entertaining, a couple of not so great lectures.
Lectures were okay. Prof didn't answer emails and seemed to resent students. No feed back was given on assignements which was annoying. Exam was long.

Very Boring. Doesnt want students to e-mail him. Covers way to much material for nothing... hardly learned anything! I really do not recommend anyone taking his class. Pol 1101 yes, but not with him as your professor.

He's a young prof, and I think he's still getting comfortable. His exam was brutally hard. Lectures were clear but he allowed people to blab on for too long about things the class didn't really want to hear. The fact that it was a 3 hour night class might have affected the mood and willingness of people to be there.

This class was kind of a disappointment because I don't feel like I learned ANYTHING! The discussions were helpful and the position papers were easy and clear assignments but the issues he chose to have us discuss weren't really relevant or interesting to most students.  There must be better sections of this course...
Professor is very knowledgable, probably too knowledgable for the good of the class. A lot of readings, and assignments are not explained clearly. Difficult to get a good mark.
The last comment sums up this prof, great guy takes like 3x amount of time to teach something. dry class
Umm, he ok i guess, does become very boring. All good when your playing games in class though

Wow, this guy was really boring and the class was useless. To top it off he grades everyone down. TA's were overly opinionated and tried to dominate discussions (marks reflected biases). God knows where his marking scheme came from. Never answers questions and whines excessively. Worst professor, period. Question mark slides... no answers. AVOID!!!

Some students intimidated when announced that A+ is unlikely.  All but one lecture interesting.  Good idea to take notes of textbook and readings.  Really helpful in explaining difficult concepts in textbook.  First experience with a discussion group and it was great.  As predicted, nil A+, three As, only one failure, rest were in range of B+ to C.
so useless,can't answer simple questions.

Nice man & class wasnt extremely boring. But takes himself too serious. Refused to answer general questions via e-mail and it always seemed that he took questions very personally. Was negative towards students that tried to engage in open dialouge or whom did not agree with his opinions. Did not provide an open minded environent. AVOID IF YOU CAN!
Worst Prof Ive had so far! i wouldn't suggest taking any class he's affiliated with. Take my word for it.

I was told by a lot of people before I took this class what a bad prof he was..but he turned out to be one of the best profs I had this semester. Really young..but he knows what he is talking about. Lectures are organized and clear.He definately goes beyond the textbook in his explainations. Assignments are easy. take his course if u can!!

First of all, he is practically identical to M. Night Shyamalan. I wish just once he would say "What a twist!" (like in Robot Chicken) Anyways...a good prof. Young, but smart for his age. His lecture can drag out a bit, but he's always open for discussions which makes it fun. For someone who dosn't really like Politics, I found this class good.

A young prof who knows alot for his age. His classes were interesting each time. Very organized and precise in what he wants. A good listener when it comes to students talking to him. Exams are not hard if you go through his slides and the readings. Very nice and open to ideas.
I guess he did gain some experience, because he is not at all like some other described him, His classes are interesting and he is good at teching overall.

He's a little anal about how he wants things, but that is a positive i think, I loove him!! at first i thought the class was a bore but once we got past the war "stuff" it got a lot more interesting. In fact, he's a little intimidating because he knows SOO much!!! He's the smartest and most knowledgeable prob ive had yet. His class is my favorite!!
I don't know what everyone is talking about. He's an awesome prof, and I hattee politics! I think he was really easy to understand and very organized :)

I thought this guy was clear and helpful. I had him at Carleton. He was very understanding about a personal situation. And I purposely took a 2nd class with him. Plus he's a feminist! Not enough male poli sci profs really teach feminism, they just gloss over it in the "other" category.
Little control over the class which means he can let some guy talk about something unimportant for an hour leaving him little time to cover stuff related to the course. Very boring lectures as well.
once he gets  a little more comfortable he willbe a great prof

He is a great teacher.  He is, of course, very knowledgeable on the topic.  Also very importantly, when he doesn't know something and he should know it, he is not afraid to admit he is wrong and try to correct it.Politics is an interesting class and he helps keep it that way! good job!
DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM!!TRUST ME!
Un mot.... Wow

didn't realize how mundane this class was until I had to drop it, and the other professor was extremely interesting. P-A refuses to take a stance or share his opinions on any topic, which does not make you want to question or analyze anything. i think it has to do w/ lack of experience. sorry, professor. avoid this class, guys.

AVOID!!!!!!! The class was death! Any other teacher could cover his three hour lecture in about 25 minutes! The assignments were not well spread out and we went into the final without knowing more than 10% of our final marks. BRUTAL!!!!! This class will make you question your existance and why you are paying so much money to attend university!

Wow. Pretty mediocre would be the best way to describe this teacher. The class is easy, but sooo boring when he takes 20 minuits to explain one slide. The discussion group participation marks are very random. He expects you to read two textbooks worth of readings before the final. I didnt read any and got a B.
Nice guy, but takes FOREVER handing stuff back. brutal

WOW..This guy was the biggest arrogant dink/crybaby ever. Not only does he treat you like your five, taking 40 min to explain a slide on office hours but he refuses to answer emails that are "bossy" ex writing "respond at your earliest convenience"..which is his job to do!!  He sent us into the final with only 10% of our final mark!!! AVOID!!

Avoid like plague!I'm an avid student - love being back in school but this class makes me want to shoot myself every week.Prof is boring, avoids making opinions, can't take criticism or direct ques. & is vindictive re. marks. Subj. has unlim. potential to be interesting but prof kills the desire to learn. Also, he has no control over the class.

This prof is the worst I had all semester. I went to maybe 5 of his classes, because everything was so boring. The class is not really that difficult, and his lectures are useless. Waste of time, switch sections if you get this guy. He only gave us 10% of our mark before the exam too... waste!

AVOID! His three hour lectures can and should be reduced to an hour considering sometimes he just talks to fill in the time. He never seems to understand what he's talking about, will put question marks on his slides because he doesn't know if he's right, and will agree with any of his students if they contradict his statements. It is quite clear h

How did this guy even get a teaching job here??  He clearly doesn't know what he's talking about, doesn't know how to answer questions that students ask, and is not willing to share his opinions on anything.  And I thought Karmis was boring...

If you're in class to get an easy mark, take a class with this professor.  If you're in class to really learn something, avoid. Seems like a genuinely nice man, but content/readings are extremely boring, his delivery is awful, and he has no control over the cocky but brainless members of the class who hijacked his lecturers with asinine comments

Once again, a ton of dry readings, but the lectures themselves are relatively interesting.  The constant "ums" appear to be more of a mannerism than uncertainty.  Exams hold no surprises and are extremely flexible (answer 5 of 20 questions).  Biggest flaw is that he will not take a stance on any issue.
He is a sweet man.. new to teaching, but in a few years will be great...

I wish I could have learned more.  WAY too much dry reading.  Discussion groups got better but they weren't the best means of learning the material.  Had so much potential but ended up being a dry class.  Wouldn't recommend it.
Inexperienced and it shows.  Boring, drawn-out, stammering lectures, poorly-answered questions, many gaps in his knowledge.  Saving grace: looks good in tight jeans.

I found this teacher VERY boring. He is not a fluid lecturer (constant ums) and does not seem to be to confident when lecturing. The information he presents in a 3 hour class would take an hour to present by another prof.

He's a younger teacher and is still passionate about what he teaches. Unfortuantely, he jus reads off of the overhead. Then again, thats what the midterm and exam are based on. Clear and offers lots of choice on tests
